org.araneaframework.uilib.form.converter
Class StringToBooleanConverter

java.lang.Object
  org.araneaframework.uilib.form.converter.BaseConverter<String,Boolean>
      org.araneaframework.uilib.form.converter.StringToBooleanConverter
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Converter<String,Boolean>, FormElementAware<String,Boolean>
public class StringToBooleanConverter
extends BaseConverter<String,Boolean>

Converts String to Boolean and back.

Since 2.0, this class completely replaces BooleanToYNConverter.

Author:
Jevgeni Kabanov (ekabanov@araneaframework.org)
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

StringToBooleanConverter

public StringToBooleanConverter()
Creates a Boolean to String converter with default settings.

StringToBooleanConverter

public StringToBooleanConverter(String trueToString,
                                String falseToString)
Creates a Boolean to String converter where true will be rendered as trueToString and false will be rendered as falseToString. The value of trueToString must be included in the array of allowed true-values!

Parameters:
trueToString - A non-empty String value this converter will use for true value.
falseToString - A non-empty String value this converter will use for false value.
Since:
2.0

StringToBooleanConverter

public StringToBooleanConverter(String[] allowedTrueValues)
Creates a Boolean to String converter that accepts given true values. Other values will be resolved to false. The array won't be checked for uniqueness nor for presence of values, however, the value of trueToString must be included.

Parameters:
allowedTrueValues - A non-null array of allowed true values.
Since:
2.0

StringToBooleanConverter

public StringToBooleanConverter(String trueToString,
                                String falseToString,
                                String[] allowedTrueValues)
Creates a Boolean to String converter where true will be rendered as trueToString and false will be rendered as falseToString.

The allowedTrueValues parameter specifies, which values will be resolved (case-insensitive) to true. Other values will be resolved to false. The array won't be checked for uniqueness nor for presence of values, however, the value of trueToString must be included.

Parameters:
trueToString - A non-empty String value this converter will use for true value.
falseToString - A non-empty String value this converter will use for false value.
allowedTrueValues - A non-null array of allowed true values.
Since:
2.0

protected static boolean contains(String[] array,
                                  String value)
The method checks whether the given array contains value (case-insensitive) value.

Parameters:
array - A non-null array of Strings.
value - A non-null and case-insensitive value to search for.
Returns:
A Boolean that is true when the array contains value.

2.0
